New Records: Quinton de Kock scored the highest score of 174 runs off 140 balls in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
Quinton de Kock hit 22 boundaries, including three sixes, in his innings.
David Miller scored 34 runs off 15 balls, the fastest in the match.
Marco Jansen took crucial wickets including Reeza Hendricks and Rassie van Dussen.
Kagiso Rabada and Keshav Maharaj contributed to the wicket-taking spree in the Bangladesh innings.
Key Match Events: South Africa's total of 382/5 was the highest score in the tournament.
Bangladesh's early dismissal of two key South Africa players turned the game around.
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller's late-order blitz secured the win for South Africa.
Mahmudullah's century was the highest for Bangladesh in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh opted to bowl first, with Shakib Al Hasan returning as captain.
South Africa started aggressively, despite a dropped catch early on.
Post-Match Reflections: Quinton de Kock was named Player of the Match for his standout performance.
South Africa moved to second place in the standings with four wins.
Bangladesh slipped to the foot of the table after the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw the highest score and win margin in the tournament.
South Africa's win boosted their confidence ahead of the World Cup.
Others: Detailed statistics and player performances were highlighted.
